title: How to Make a Chocolate and Vanilla Sheet Cake

steps.headline: Mix the cocoa, flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl.
Crack in the eggs and add the oil.
steps.description: Mix well with a rubber spatula.

steps.headline: Pour in the milk and vanilla.
steps.description: Blend using an electric mixer until the batter forms.

steps.headline: Scrape the excess cake batter from the sides using a rubber spatula.
Cream the butter and sugar in a large bowl until the mixture is light and fluffy.
Crack in the eggs and add the vanilla extract.
Fold in the flour and baking powder.
steps.description: Blend on low speed slowly. The batter will be slightly dry.

steps.headline: Pour in the milk and blend until the cake batter has no flour streaks.
Scrape the excess cake batter from the sides using a rubber spatula.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (175 degrees Celsius).
Grease and flour a large glass baking dish.
Pour the chocolate batter into the baking dish.
Pour the vanilla batter on top of the chocolate in the baking dish.
Bake the cake in the oven for about 35-45 minutes, until the cake is golden brown.
Allow the cake to cool on a wire rack for about 10-13 minutes.
Serve.
steps.description: If desired, frost and decorate the cake with anything of your choice. Slice the cake and place a piece on a serving plate. Enjoy!

text: Making the Chocolate Batter Mix the cocoa, flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl.  Crack in the eggs and add the oil. Mix well with a rubber spatula. Pour in the milk and vanilla. Blend using an electric mixer until the batter forms. Scrape the excess cake batter from the sides using a rubber spatula.  Set aside.  Making the Vanilla Batter Cream the butter and sugar in a large bowl until the mixture is light and fluffy.  Crack in the eggs and add the vanilla extract. Blend again. Fold in the flour and baking powder. Blend on low speed slowly. The batter will be slightly dry. Pour in the milk and blend until the cake batter has no flour streaks.  Scrape the excess cake batter from the sides using a rubber spatula.  Set aside.  Baking Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (175 degrees Celsius).  Grease and flour a large glass baking dish.  Pour the chocolate batter into the baking dish.  Pour the vanilla batter on top of the chocolate in the baking dish.  Bake the cake in the oven for about 35-45 minutes, until the cake is golden brown.  Allow the cake to cool on a wire rack for about 10-13 minutes.  Serve. If desired, frost and decorate the cake with anything of your choice. Slice the cake and place a piece on a serving plate. Enjoy!
